sub_title: Head of Global Compensation at Adevinta
summary:
Welcome to my profile! 

My name is Mikel, experienced rewards professional with several years of experience in a wide variety of industries, including: Oil & Gas, Hospitality, Consulting (Real Estate), Automotive, Media, FMCG and Start up environment. 

Graduated with a Master in International HR Management at the Université Paris Panthéon Assas CIFFOP, I have worked in several countries in Europe including, Spain, France, Belgium , UK and Austria and can speak Spanish, French, English and Basque fluently (Also currently learning German!)

When I am out of work, I am usually practicing some sport, sharing moments with friends or traveling! 

If you are willing to know anything else just contact me! 

Mikel Aiastui Zubia 
aiasmikel@gmail.com

profile_positions.description:
In this unique role, I am in charge of setting up the C&B function of VanMoof from scratch. 

I'm responsible for the global C&B Strategy and developing initiatives whilst upholding the local regulations, market practices, internal policies and CLA agreements. I work in close relationship with the rest of the HR community as well as Finance and Legal department.

Main projects since joining have been:
- Built the C&B philosophy aligned with company values and mission.
- Designed, Implemented and Communicated a Job Leveling Structure across the organization.
- Created Salary Ranges for all of our locations (NL, UK, FR, DE, US, TP, JP).
- Implemented a standard Benchmarking tool & process.
- Designed a new annual compensation calendar, including the pay & performance review.
- Budgeting for the annual salary increases and performance awards
- Benefits Harmonization
- Implemented company pension schemes in the Netherlands and US (401K).
- Introduced a new Health/Fitness program.
- Brought structure to the existing ESOP plan (Employee Stock Option Plan).
- Reviewed our dutch collective health insurance discount with several providers.

On top of the more obvious responsibilities, I created and lead the Pride Taskforce at VanMoof 🌈 something that I've become very passionate about!

profile_positions.description:
Aligning Delphi technologies compensation strategy across 26 countries after the spin-off from Delphi Automotive. 

In this role I make sure that the compensation of our workforce of 20,000 employees (5,000 engineers) in 26 countries is competitive. 

The main projects that I have led are: 
- Implement and train on a global approach to the annual merit and bonus review
- Design, Implement and Train on a new Job Evaluation Tool 
- Pay for Performance analysis to identify countries/regions were there was a gap in pay for performance. 
- Cost control of the budget of our salary surveys, saving approx. 50,000 $ to the company. 
- Harmonize the different Incentive Plans across the globe to gain on efficiency and aligned the plans with the new corporate goals. 
- Work with finance in the design of new incentive plans. Including financials metrics and pay curve. 

My responsibilities include:

-Analyzing the market and keeping our labor economics database up to date. Taking this database as a reference we make assumptions regarding our compensation budget for next year.   
-Developing, designing and implementing salary structures all around the world by evaluating and benchmarking roles using different market data providers (WTW, Hay, Mercer & Aon)
-Global merit planning
-Managing the Global non-Executive Incentive Plan. 
-Being the point of contact for any compensation related matter. 
-After spin off from Delphi Automotive, aligning & harmonizing Delphi Technologies compensation strategy around world
- Part of the team designing the Workday compensation module

profile_positions.description:
Located at Aon Headquarters in London, I am part of the European Talent Reward and Performance team. 

My responsibilities at Aon included managing salary and benefit surveys as well as participating in consulting projects. 

During my time at Aon I have been able to work in several consulting projects across several industries. This projects included: 

-	Equal Pay Audit for a big IT multinational company. Including the analysis for 36 countries. 
-	Job Bench-marking of 90 roles for one of the biggest Real Estate Development company in London using different data sources. 
-	Job Bench-marking of 180 roles for one of the biggest Oil & Gas companies in the world. 
-	Job Evaluation using JobLink (factor and points methodology) for a pharmaceutical company 
-	Custom Salary Survey for an Oil & Gas company. 
-	Gender pay reporting for several companies
-	Performance management audit and recommendation for a real estate company

Salary and Benefit surveys:

I am the Project Manager of the Commercial Real Estate survey portfolio at Aon. Aon has the following real estate surveys:
-	Property Investment Management Survey for real estate investors and developers. 
-	Property Sector Rewards Survey for real estate brokers, agencies and consulting firms.
-	Planning Survey for planners 
-	European Property Sector Rewards Survey for brokers and agencies at a European level. 

For the first time in the UK, Aon launched the 2018 Car Benefits and Transportation survey which I have been leading. My responsibilities included:
-	Reaching out possible clients. 52 participants.
-	Customer relationship 
-	Data collection 
-	Data analysis and auditing
-	Create final Report
